name: Pivot Animator Animation
summary: Learn about .PIV files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Pivot Animator is a Windows program that allows you to create simple stick figure animations, which can include moving characters, text, and other objects. For example, you can create an animation in which two stick figures have an argument and then fight to the death, within the span of a dozen frames.

Animations created in Pivot Animator are saved as PIV files. Each PIV file stores an animation's included frames, characters, objects, and background image(s). After you open a PIV file in Pivot Animator, you can play and/or edit the animation it contains.

description: A .piv file is a file format used by Pivot Animator, a software used for creating stick figure animations. The .piv file contains the animation data created by the user in the software. The format is specific to Pivot Animator and may not be supported by other animation software.

A PIV file is an animation created by Pivot Animator, a program used to create stick figure animations. It contains a series of frames, in which one or more stick figures perform actions. Pivot Animator includes many sample PIV files, which animators can use as templates.

instructions:
To open a .piv file in Pivot Animator, follow these steps:

Download and install Pivot Animator on your computer if you haven’t already.Open Pivot Animator.Select “File” > “Open” from the menu.Navigate to the location of the .piv file you want to open.Select the .piv file and click “Open.”The animation will be loaded and displayed in Pivot Animator.You can now edit the animation or play it by selecting “Play” > “Play Animation.”
You can open a PIV file in Pivot Animator (Windows):
Navigate to your PIV file and select Open.
After you open your PIV file, you can play the animation it contains by clicking the Play button.
